articles.description: Heroic Scotland's bid to reach Euro 2024 was agonisingly prolonged after a frustrating defeat in Spain inflicted their first defeat of the campaign.
articles.title: Agony for Scotland as Spain defeat delays Euro spot

articles.description: The FA has "tried to make the best decision with good intentions" over tributes to those who have died in Israel and Gaza, according to Gareth Southgate.
articles.title: FA 'tried to make best decision' on Israel & Gaza - Southgate

articles.description: Mark Telea is dropped by New Zealand for Saturday's Rugby World Cup quarter-final with Ireland after breaking team protocol.
articles.title: All Blacks drop winger Telea over protocol breach

articles.description: Australia suffer their heaviest World Cup defeat as they are beaten by South Africa in Lucknow.
articles.title: South Africa trounce woeful Australia at World Cup

articles.description: The Russian Olympic Committee has been suspended "with immediate effect" says the International Olympic Committee.
articles.title: IOC suspends Russian Olympic Committee

articles.description: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke feels sorry for his players after a 2-0 defeat by Spain delayed qualification for Euro 2024.
articles.title: Clarke 'feels sorry' for Scotland after Spain loss

articles.description: Marcus Smith should start England's World Cup quarter-final against Fiji at full-back with captain Owen Farrell at fly-half, says Chris Ashton.
articles.title: England's Smith should start at full-back - Ashton

articles.description: Daniel Akinkunmi has only been playing American football for two years but has been recruited by one of the top colleges in the US.
articles.title: 'Is this real?' - UK teen takes next step on path to NFL dream

articles.description: Newcastle's Sandro Tonali and Aston Villa's Nicolo Zaniolo left Italy's training camp after being told they are involved in an investigation by Italian prosecutors.
articles.title: Zaniolo & Tonali leave Italy camp over investigation

articles.description: Australia manager Graham Arnold uses Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou to try to inspire his side before their friendly against England.
articles.title: Postecoglou inspires Socceroos before England game
